author: paschott
body:
Tried to install or update the module. Also tried repairing my PS 7 install.  Install/Update works in PS 6 but ends up using a different module path for those modules.

# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
update-module dbatools
install-module dbachecks
```

# Expected behavior

```
Expected the module to update or install.  I haven't had an issue until today with updating or installing modules. Both gave similar errors.
```

# Actual behavior

```
PS C:\Windows\System32> update-module dbatools
InvalidOperation: C:\Program Files\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\PowerShellGet\1.0.0.1\PSModule.psm1:7326
Line |
7326 |      if(-not $script:IsWindows -or
     |              ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
     | The variable '$script:IsWindows' cannot be retrieved because it has not been set.

Import-PackageProvider: C:\Program Files\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\PowerShellGet\1.0.0.1\PSModule.psm1:7365
Line |
7365 |  …     $null = PackageManagement\Import-PackageProvider -Name $script:Nu …
     |                ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
     | No match was found for the specified search criteria and provider name 'NuGet'. Try 'Get-PackageProvider
     | -ListAvailable' to see if the provider exists on the system.

InvalidOperation: C:\Program Files\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\PowerShellGet\1.0.0.1\PSModule.psm1:7437
Line |
7437 |      $shouldContinueQueryMessage = $LocalizedData.InstallNuGetProvider …
     |                                    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
     | The variable '$LocalizedData' cannot be retrieved because it has not been set.

InvalidOperation: C:\Program Files\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\PowerShellGet\1.0.0.1\PSModule.psm1:7438
Line |
7438 |      $shouldContinueCaption = $LocalizedData.InstallNuGetProviderShoul …
     |                               ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
     | The variable '$LocalizedData' cannot be retrieved because it has not been set.
```

# Environment data


comments.body: Looks like you might be sourcing an old version of PowerShellGet from C:\Program Files\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\PowerShellGet\1.0.0.1.
